lexUnit.name: challenging.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: requiring a person's full abilities and effort

sentence.text: The forthcoming New Zealand tour presents a very difficult itinerary : Auckland , Canterbury , two Tests and four challenging midweek games .
All the competitors agreed that they had a challenging game and more than the usual number of wet balls and soggy bunkers ! !

Fabric D , Buncrana Warehouse and Ballymacarry MIX all moved into challenging positions .
He started at the back , remained there for a lap and , when the pace was turned up , was unable to get within a challenging position .
Invaluable as this sort of computing may be , the archaeologist 's spade reveals more interesting and mathematically challenging problems .
Attempted suicide continues to present a very challenging problem for medical and psychiatric services .
Soft linings for dentures , which are required or at least desired by many patients , are a challenging research problem .

The present flora , vegetation , and landscape of the Outer Hebrides thus pose several interesting and challenging questions .

Prayer is the most challenging call in this ministry ; if you would like to join the prayer chain do contact the team .

As we all know marine fishkeeping is a challenging hobby in so many ways .
